H5186.def: = state in which a relatively straight object is shaped into a curve

H241.def: = one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

H4120.def: = action by which humans or deities act without delay

H5337.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from a situation where it could be damaged

H6697.def: = hard stony material ◄ that forms the crust of the earth, sometimes exposed on the surface, sometimes hidding under the soil; ≈ associated with hardness, permanence, and security

H4581.def: = large fortification; for the defense of a town; built of stone; could consist of one extra strong building or of a complex of buildings surrounded by its own strong wall; ≈ associated with protection and security and often used as an epithet for God

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H3467.def: = action by which humans or deities help themselves in a (difficult) situation

H5148.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or animals to move or be moved from one place to another

H5095.def: = action by which humans and their domestic animals journey from one place to the other

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H7568.def: = net of unknown size and shape; ► used for hunting birds and other animals, and also for fishing; ≈ associated with aggression and control

H2934.def: = action by which humans cause themselves to be invisible so that their location cannot be determined

H4581.def: = large fortification; for the defense of a town; built of stone; could consist of one extra strong building or of a complex of buildings surrounded by its own strong wall; ≈ associated with protection and security and often used as an epithet for God

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H6485.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe a person, group, or object ► with the purpose of determining their well-being, condition, and/or integrity

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H6299.def: = causative action by which humans exchange animals or other humans by substituting them with money or with an(other) animal, ► as a result of which they will escape death or slavery

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H571.def: = state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions

H8130.def: = state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H1892.def: = a slight movement of air; ≈ associated with something without substance, that quickly passes away

H7723.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H1523.def: mainly in poetical texts: = state in which humans feel and show great joy

H8055.def: = state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H6040.def: literally: to be bowed down; hence: = state in which humans are suffering hardship and trouble and unable to help themselves

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H6869.def: = a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H5462.def: = causative action by which humans or deities close the entrance to a space with the help of a {L:door<SDBH:דֶּלֶת>}

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H5975.def: = process by which humans, deities, animals, or inanimate objects take position in a certain location in an upright position

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H4800.def: literally: broadness; hence: = a relatively large area of open land

H2603.def: = state in which humans or deities are favorably disposed to (other) humans, and act accordingly

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6244.def: = process by which part of the human body loses strength and therefore becomes unable to function well ◄ as a result of grief

H3708.def: = state in which human experience displeasure, which is said to reside in their {L:heart<SDBH:לֵב>} ◄ and is caused by their own condition or by someone else

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H990.def: = front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects

H3615.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

H3015.def: = process by which humans experience sorrow and suffering

H585.def: = act by which humans make a deep inarticulate sound ◄ caused by pain, grief, or severe suffering

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H3782.def: = process by which humans trip or temporarily lose their balance when walking; ≈ often used figuratively to denote failure

H3581.def: = state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

H6106.def: = any of the pieces of hard, whitish material that together consitute the skeleton of humans and animals; ≈ associated with strength

H6244.def: = process by which part of the human body loses strength and therefore becomes unable to function well ◄ as a result of grief

H2781.def: = state in which humans feel shame and humiliation, ◄ due to one's own shortcomings or misfortune and/or contempt from other people

H6343.def: = process by which humans tremble or shake, ◄ as a result of a strong emotion of fear and concern for one's safety

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H5074.def: = action by which humans or animals move away in haste from a certain place ► in order to escape from a situation that is considered dangerous

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H2351.def: = referent to the location outside of an object

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H6.def: = state of not being located in the place where it is expected to be

H3627.def: = human-made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes

H1681.def: = action by which humans give a verbal report concerning circumstances or events, usually with evil intentions

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H4032.def: = state in which humans live in a place which is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time

H3245.def: = causative action by which humans put in place the bottom part of a building or larger structure, usually below the ground level, which will have to bear the entire construction

H2161.def: = action by which deities or humans put together a plan or strategy to act on; often in a bad sense

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H5337.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from a situation where it could be damaged

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H7291.def: = action by which humans go behind (other) humans or animals, usually at an increased speed

H215.def: = process by which something reflects light; ≈ associated with well-being

H5650.def: = man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

H3467.def: = action by which humans or deities help themselves in a (difficult) situation

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H954.def: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H7585.def: = abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment

H8267.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H481.def: = to be unable to speak ◄ because of a physical limitation or because of emotions

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H6662.def: = state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H1346.def: = state in which a substance increases in volume, which manifests itself in an increasing height

H937.def: = state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H2898.def: = state in which objects are of a high quality and/or a pleasure to look at

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H6845.def: = action by which humans hide themselves ► in order to attack another person

H3373.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H6466.def: = action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H2620.def: = action by which humans and animals who find themselves in difficult circumstances go to a certain location, ► in order to find protection or safety

H5641.def: = state in which people or objects are in a location where they cannot be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them

H6845.def: = action by which humans hide themselves ► in order to attack another person

H5521.def: = a shelter, ◄ made of fragile materials such as leaves and branches, ► for the purpose of protection from rain and sun for both humans and animals; used by people who needed a temporary shelter, such as nomads, soldiers, and farm workers in the field; ≈ by extension, figuratively God's protection over his people, God's shelter for himself; also a metaphor for Jerusalem, the dwelling of God's people; also by extension, a place where ferocious animals can hide in order to attack someone

H7379.def: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons, perhaps even involving a deity

H3956.def: = the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

H1288.def: = causative action by which humans cause animals to fall on their knees

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6381.def: = state in which an event is out of the ordinary, inspiring amazement, and usually associated with the supernatural

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H4692.def: = state of severe sorrow or anguish

H2648.def: = process by which humans or animals are overcome by a sudden uncontrollable fear or anxiety resulting in a frenzied hurry to run away

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H1629.def: = causative action by which someone or something is removed from his place with force

H403.def: = marker used to affirm the truth of the following statement

H8469.def: = to try to win a favorable attitude from someone else; ◄ by approaching that person in a very humble way

H7768.def: = action by which humans and animals raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else

8.gl: to do (something) in an extraordinary way

H157.def: = state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H2623.def: = someone who practices חֶסֶד, who is committed towards fulfilling his/her obligations; these may be obligations defined within the context of a covenant or agreement, or moral obligations to do well to someone who did well to you before

H5341.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H529.def: = state in which humans are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their actions

H3499.def: = what remains in existence after part of the original quantity has disappeared or has been used or dealt with in a certain way; used for humans, animals, plants, and inanimate objects

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H1346.def: = state in which a substance increases in volume, which manifests itself in an increasing height

H2388.def: = state in which humans or deities are strong in a physical, political, or military sense, or simply in their ability to convince others with words

H553.def: = state in which humans have political and/or military strength

H3824.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H3176.def: = action by which humans delay action until the right moment, with a certain amount of confidence that this moment will actually come

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
